DOC.brief_summary: The main goal of this study is to determine whether the American Heart Association-recommended fish oil dose is efficacious, safe, and tolerable in hemodialysis patients. The secondary objective is to test the effects of fish oil supplementation on inflammatory and cardiovascular markers.
DOC.brief_title: A Pilot Study of Fish Oil Supplementation in Hemodialysis Patients
DOC.criteria: 1. Age <18 2. Pregnant individuals 3. Fish oil or omega3 supplementation in past 6 months 4. Fish, corn, soybean, gelatin, or vanilla allergies 5. Currently enrolled in a dietary or investigational drug study 6. Life expectancy < 3 months 7. Ongoing active illness requiring hospitalization 8. Malabsorption syndromes 9. Chronic heparin or coumadin anticoagulation (??) 10. Active bleeding issues
